description:
The documentation at 
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/list-of-compute-config-options.html 
for the compute_driver configuration option in nova.conf says:
"For convenience if the driver exists under the nove.virt namespace, nova.virt can be removed."

The nova.virt seems to be required, however - see for example: https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg18632.html - and the documentation should be changed to reflect that.
title: Correction required for list of nova.conf configuration options for grizzly

comments.content:
The documentation at 
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/list-of-compute-config-options.html 
for the compute_driver configuration option in nova.conf says:
"For convenience if the driver exists under the nove.virt namespace, nova.virt can be removed."

The nova.virt seems to be required, however - see for example: https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg18632.html - and the documentation should be changed to reflect that.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~patrickvinas

comments.content: Documentation bug, not a code bug.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mikal

comments.content:
Hi 
i would like to take up this bug and fix.  Shall I investigate ? 
-Dheerendra
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dheerendra-purohit

comments.content:
Hi 

I did some investigation on this bug.  Grizzly releae nova.conf does not have entry like. However I'm able to see the same in folsom documentation.  This bug can be closed ?

-Dheerendra
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dheerendra-purohit

comments.content: This is not referenced anymore in the current documentation, thus closing as WONTFIX.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jaegerandi
